title: SQL
content:
SQL (Structured Query Language)- Standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases. 

creating a table: CREATE TABLE  table_name
(column_name1 datatype (size) NOT NULL, 
   ...
)
*NOT NULL: enforces a column to NOT accept NULL values. 
ex: 
CREATE TABLE Persons
( 
   PersonID int,
   LastName varchar (255),
   FirstName varchar (255),
   Address varchar (255), 
   City varchar (255),
); 

INSERT a Record

INSERT INTO table_name
('id', 'name', 'attendance')
VALUES
(1, 'John', 1)
(2, 'John',1)
(3, 'Jane',1)
(4, 'Jane', 0)
...
;

Update a record
UPDATE Student_Attendance
SET attendance=1
WHERE name="jane" AND date=...;
(WHERE somecolumn=somevalue)

DISTINCT
SELECT DISTINCT(column name) FROM tableName WHERE column name=...;
